description: From Middle English twifold, twifald, from Old English twifeald (“double, twofold”), from Proto-Germanic *twifaldaz (“twofold”), equivalent to twi- +‎ fold. Cognate with Middle High German zwivalt (“double”), Old Norse tvífaldr (“double”), Icelandic tvöfaldur (“double”).

adjectives.description: twifold (comparative more twifold, superlative most twifold)

adverbs.description: twifold (comparative more twifold, superlative most twifold)

entries.meaning: (archaic) In a twofold manner or measure.
